key_points: James and Jennifer Crumbley plead not guilty to involuntary manslaughter charges related to their son's involvement in a Michigan high school shooting.
Ethan Crumbley, their 15-year-old son, charged with murder and other crimes following the shooting that killed four students.
The incident timeline highlights a series of concerning behaviors and missed warnings including Ethan's social media posts and a disturbing note found at school.
James Crumbley purchased the gun used in the shooting days before the incident; Ethan had posted about this new gun on Instagram.
A teacher found Ethan searching for ammunition online at school, which was reported to the school officials.
Another teacher discovered Ethan's note with drawings of a handgun and phrases indicating distress and violence.
Despite these signs, school counselors did not believe Ethan posed a threat after evaluating his behavior and responses.
Ethan's parents refused to take him home from school on the day of the shooting after being shown the disturbing note.
Ethan shot and wounded students and a teacher shortly after his parents left the school.
Following a manhunt, the Crumbleys were arrested and a third-party review of the events leading up to the shooting was announced.
